decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost creatures and artifacts, utilizing cards like Hardened Scales and Steel Overseer to bolster their power and toughness. By using cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar to create tokens and generate additional value, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and aggressive playstyle. Additionally, Evolutionary Leap provides a form of card advantage and Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur key artifacts from the graveyard.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disruption and card advantage, using cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the game while also deploying threats like Grim Flayer, Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet, and Noxious Gearhulk to pressure the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Once Upon a Time and Traverse the Ulvenwald to ensure consistent land drops and find key pieces. With a mix of removal, hand disruption, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless assault while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost Spirit creatures and pump them up with anthems like Empyrean Eagle and Favorable Winds. Key cards like Nebelgast Herald and Spell Queller disrupt opponents' strategies while Brazen Borrower provides versatility. Card draw and evasion are also important aspects of this aggressive strategy, with cards like Curious Obsession and Rattlechains helping to maintain tempo. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with flying, efficient creatures while maintaining resilience through cards like Selfless Spirit and Hanged Executioner.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient and aggressive creatures like Steel Leaf Champion, Lovestruck Beast, and Questing Beast. Supporting cards like Domri Rade and Smuggler's Copter provide card advantage and additional threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of large creatures and direct damage from cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Glorybringer. By utilizing mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck can quickly ramp into its powerful threats and put pressure on opponents early in the game.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with quick, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By using cards like Bomat Courier, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage, you can put pressure on your opponent early in the game. Follow up with efficient burn spells like Lightning Strike and Skewer the Critics to finish off your opponent. The goal is to deal damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Light Up the Stage to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on. The deck is built around fast, aggressive play and aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to effectively ramp up mana with green cards while controlling the board with various gates and powerful creatures. The deck aims to quickly get out key cards such as Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Field of the Dead to overwhelm opponents with a horde of zombies. The inclusion of cards like Kozilek's Return and Elder Deep-Fiend provide additional control options, while the toolbox of gates allows for flexibility in mana fixing and searching. Ultimately, the deck seeks to establish a strong board presence and outvalue opponents through efficient ramp and control strategies.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using green spells and lands to cast powerful high-cost creatures like Dragonlord Atarka and Sylvan Primordial. The deck also incorporates control elements like Blast Zone and Scavenger Grounds to disrupt opponent's strategies. The inclusion of cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Chandra, Flamecaller provide additional control and board presence. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with large threats while maintaining control of the battlefield. Additionally, the deck utilizes Field of the Dead to generate zombie tokens for added defense and offense.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures using cards like Gather the Pack, Grisly Salvage, and Once Upon a Time. This sets up powerful graveyard synergies with cards like Lotleth Troll, Soulflayer, and Zetalpa, Primal Dawn. The aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Rhonas the Indomitable allow for fast and powerful attacks, while removal spells like Murderous Rider help control the board. The mana base of Blooming Marsh, Woodland Cemetery, and dual lands allows for consistent casting of spells across both colors.

The deck focuses on efficiently utilizing low-cost, aggressive white creatures to overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing cards like Brave the Elements and Declaration in Stone to protect and remove threats, along with creatures that buff each other like Thalia's Lieutenant and Benalish Marshal, the deck aims to build a wide board presence early in the game. Key cards like Kytheon, Hero of Akros provide additional utility and potential for a quick win. With a low mana curve and a focus on aggressive plays, the deck aims to pressure opponents and win through creature damage.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with pump spells to deal a lot of damage quickly to the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Steel Leaf Champion and Questing Beast with combat tricks such as Temur Battle Rage and Aspect of Hydra, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Once Upon a Time to help find key creatures quickly and Llanowar Elves to ramp into its threats ahead of schedule.

The deck focuses on control and manipulating the pace of the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. The key strategy is to survive long enough to cast Approach of the Second Sun to win the game. The deck includes various counterspells, removal spells, card draw engines, and planeswalkers to control the game and eventually win with the alternate win condition of Approach of the Second Sun. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to blue and white mana sources.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Transgress the Mind, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Murderous Rider. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Pack Rat and Gifted Aetherborn, while also generating card advantage with cards like Liliana, the Last Hope and Sign in Blood. The deck also has some versatility with cards like Gonti, Lord of Luxury and Rankle, Master of Pranks to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to utilize cards like Anticipate, Possibility Storm, and Fae of Wishes to quickly set up game-winning combos, while efficiently ramping up mana with cards like Elvish Mystic and Gilded Goose. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides disruption and control, while Lovestruck Beast and Rosethorn Acolyte offer strong creature presence. Enter the Infinite and Borborygmos Enraged serve as powerful finishers, with Once Upon a Time ensuring consistency in drawing key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggro pressure and versatile combo potential.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble Jeskai Ascendancy and utilize its abilities to generate mana and draw cards while buffing your creatures. The deck includes a mix of card selection, ramp, and protection spells to help you find the combo pieces quickly and protect them once they are on the battlefield. By efficiently cycling through your deck and generating mana, you can overwhelm your opponent with a massive board state and quickly close out the game.

This Red Deck Wins aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy involves utilizing a mix of powerful aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Reality Smasher, alongside versatile burn spells like Wild Slash and Abrade to chip away at the opponent's life total quickly. The inclusion of cards like Embercleave and Chandra, Torch of Defiance offers additional reach and damage potential to close out games swiftly. Overall, the deck aims to maintain pressure and aggression throughout the match to secure a fast victory.

This deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to pressure the opponent early in the game. The key strategy is to play aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Eidolon of the Great Revel, while also using burn spells like Lightning Strike and Boros Charm to clear the way for direct damage. By maintaining a high tempo and applying constant pressure, this deck aims to close out games swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.
